text:
Hey <@U01MM4EAC69> :wave::skin-tone-3: jumping in here. I don't have a content background, I am more demand / marketing ops / martech but quick question - how do define an SQL? Is it a demo request? I took a quick look at the site and it seems like your a relatively enterprise software? 

I think when you go after higher volume of traffic , you may be chasing higher volume Kw which necessarily aren't high intent. Higher intent may be lower volume - the way we sort of look at it is augementing your content / organic with paid efforts. For example running bottom of funnel paid search campaigns to super targeted landing pages. Running mid-funnel campaigns by plugging in relevant content and surfacing it to in-market buyers and building brand affinity top of funnel. It's very hard to equate increase in traffic to pipeline because traffic can mean different intent / types. A very tactical thing I would try is install some reverse IP lookup / heatmap to see who's coming to the site / what is their behaviour. 
For enterprise software if the sales cycle is 6-12mo it's very hard to drive SQLs just off content alone imo. 
The other question is - are you attributing SQLs to content via last click? Or is this more “gated” content your trying to attribute SQLs to? 

I am doing 30min consults on content + demand (<@UJG9WTEKG> was kind enough to let me sponsor) so happy to chat more — :calendar: <https://book.vimcal.com/p/BvmCY72ta1KSBxpo|https://book.vimcal.com/p/BvmCY72ta1KSBxpo>

text: Agreed with <@UUXMCJQ15> that an influencer marketing platform would do this, but many of them don't have LinkedIn APIs (unless that has changed in the past couple months!). I've used a lot of them and many only include LinkedIn stats if the user has added their profile directly. Some to check out though: CreatorIQ, AspireIQ, Klear, IZEA.

text: I might be misunderstanding your Q but GA sessions time out after 30 min or so (depending on your setting) so it'll show as a “new” visit every time. Unless you have UID enabled - but I believe that's only for “web-app” not website users.

elements.text: I might be misunderstanding your Q but GA sessions time out after 30 min or so (depending on your setting) so it'll show as a “new” visit every time. Unless you have UID enabled - but I believe that's only for “web-app” not website users.

text: How would you design a project plan for your team to develop the production workflows of your content marketing operation?

elements.text: How would you design a project plan for your team to develop the production workflows of your content marketing operation?

text:
I don't know the specifics of your content marketing engine, but in general, I would lay out:

• The problem(s) to solve (_What specific painpoints are we running into with our current workflow?)_
• The desired end state / goal _(What does an excellent deliverable look like for this project?)_
• Requirements and guardrails _(Ex: what content types we need to develop the workflows for; budget for tech or tools)_
I would keep the instructions/project assignment simple and let my team run with it from there.

elements.text: I don't know the specifics of your content marketing engine, but in general, I would lay out:
The problem(s) to solve (
What specific painpoints are we running into with our current workflow?)
The desired end state / goal
(What does an excellent deliverable look like for this project?)
Requirements and guardrails
(Ex: what content types we need to develop the workflows for; budget for tech or tools)
I would keep the instructions/project assignment simple and let my team run with it from there.

text: Thanks. I had the `desired end state` and various `requirements and guardrails` articulated but something felt missing. Your outline and the tip to keep it simple made me realize that due to the assignment asking them to design an engine from scratch, that missing thing was an existing process to adapt and not necessary for them to tackle the project.
